snippet: The brother-in-law of Syed Rizwan Farook, who carried out the rampage with his wife, expressed sorrow for the victims and bafflement at what had driven the couple.
abstract: Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik, couple who killed 14 people and wounded 21 others at social services center in San Bernadino, Calif, before dying in shoot-out with police, lived quietly at home in suburbs; investigators attempt to find motives in killings, as two become one of most baffling and mysterious pairs in recent history of mass homicide.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, IAN LOVETT, JULIE TURKEWITZ and BENJAMIN MUELLER
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney and Julie Turkewitz reported from San Bernardino; Ian Lovett from Riverside, Calif.; and Benjamin Mueller from New York. Rick Rojas contributed reporting from San Bernardino, and Eric Schmitt and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Jack Begg contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: The brother-in-law of Syed Rizwan Farook, who carried out the rampage with his wife, expressed sorrow for the victims and bafflement at what had driven the couple.

headline.main: Couple Kept Tight Lid on Plans for San Bernardino Shooting
headline.print_headline: A Couple Who Lived Quietly, Motives Unknown
